column5: Fascinating to see how the rise of generative AI is leading to the emergence of not just new critical skill sets, but entirely new roles
Enjoyed my conversation with Hisham Hamadeh, Global Head of Data Science at @Genmab, about #ChatGPT, #generativeAI and the future of drug discovery. https://t.co/38vqqORKrz

The rise of ChatGPT and other generative AI platforms is not the end of the road for smart humans. It just reinforces how important it will be in the future to ask the right questions, and to critically deconstruct whether the answers you receive can be trusted and to what extent https://t.co/0sp2zH83Nz
A great example of where AI-powered #whispertech is heading - a trend I predicted in my 2019 book, The Algorithmic Leader, where I also profiled Josh Browder as a fascinating innovator to watch.

The shocking arrival of ChatGPT released by @openAI late last year comes exactly ten years after @geoffreyhinton and his team won the 2012 ImageNet competition, unleashing a decade of AI innovation. Now is the right time to ask ourselves - how do we need to evolve? https://t.co/ZIUMEV6OY2
@BrianRoemmele Such an interesting topic - it’s something I wrote about as a thought experiment too a while back https://t.co/KLs1UxkWIt
I sure did! He was a profound influence…
My Tokyo inspired take on the future of the #metaverse, explained in 8 minutes https://t.co/P4IdFYXZ9T
@balajis @nealstephenson had a similar conjecture in his book ‘Fall’ - that in the near future we would have social editors creating a personalized bubble of truth - protocol as subjective veil.
@fchollet Culture is an operating system
@vgr Along similar lines - I’ve been exploring the idea that the grassroots, emergent metaverse we would hope for - is not a place, but also a set of protocols.
With #IFA2022 about to begin in Berlin this week, what better time to explore the future of retail stores? @IFA_Berlin @arcelik https://t.co/FqfPrKGKq1
@duncanjwatts I think we can all be eternally grateful that you first published game-changing research that changed how we thought about the Web before publishing your own website!
@tprstly Dystopian sci-fi makes for handy business plan generation because writers tend to spell out who wins and loses. Utopian fiction less so - because most miss the irony.
@tprstly Probably also worth reminding everyone who read ‘Snowcrash’ of the same thing #Metaverse
@BrianRoemmele I hear the 2022 model has an optional machine gun mount…
@michaeljknowles Clearly he minted it after being airdropped a mutant serum…
@cdibona @harper @mattb Dopplr, Flickr, and the early days of Twitter - all felt like the human centric future we hoped for but didn’t deserve
@JamesBessen Congrats on the new book!
@nateliason Great piece @nateliason!
@leverus Looking forward to it!
@sama Human Level Interaction (as opposed to human-like imitation)
@BruceMctague @harper Yes I did - on my old Leica M6 rangefinder with expired Agfa Ultra film stock. Seemed suitable for a book on the future of entertainment in 2007!
@harper …especially on analogue film cameras, where every photo was a meditative act.
Honored to be part of this list of some of my favorite books and authors!
@marty Where is it from? Looks like late 80s space camp
@harper What we need is a wall of sound - nothing less!
@harper Algorithmic revisionism. Buckle up - it’s only just beginning…
@benedictevans #Schadenfreude
@paulg People often underestimate how hard it is to write about complex ideas in a simple way. They mistake elegant abstraction for naïveté or popularism.

You might think this is an algorithmically generated piece from a high floor NFT collection but it is in fact a work by a Cuban-American artist Carmen Herrera, who died this week aged 106. A pioneer in geometric abstraction, global recognition arrived finally when she was 89 #nft https://t.co/kBfqs2InaL
Billion-year-old black diamond from space up for auction. Clearly an Infinity Stone. @MarvelStudios  https://t.co/vxwix0wlOo

The future of work in the post-pandemic age is bigger than the rise of remote work, the 'Great Resignation' or the inevitable arrival of some kind of corporatized Metaverse. The real question is: what do we work to be? https://t.co/vFXYLdWaTY #FutureOfWork

According to Dave Johnson, Chief Data and AI Officer at @moderna_tx, it was the software-like, digital nature of mRNA technology that inspired the company to fashion themselves in the form of a new type of digital biotech company. Listen to the interview: https://t.co/P7NvUF7bFp https://t.co/vxpK6oy7kc

A brilliant piece from @carlyayres about how the rise of design automation is an opportunity for designers to reinvent the value of what they do and why they do it https://t.co/TF6weG9WSb #algorithmicleader #design
‘I’m not trying to be anyone’s savior. I’m just trying to think about the future and not be sad.’ Elon Musk https://t.co/ofkpbsOm1E
The idea of a ‘Slow Apocalypse’ is even more shockingly relevant at the dawn of 2022 than it was when William Gibson said it in 2019
@pmddomingos “Overhead, without any fuss, the stars were going out.” The Nine Billion Names of God - Arthur C. Clarke
@nicolasnova @feraldata Thanks for sharing @feraldata - a brilliant exploration of of the shadow side of how we assemble narratives about the future
Honored to be included on the @real_leaders list of top global keynote speakers for 2022 #digitaltransformation #AI #future https://t.co/O4XPQBlKIj
My latest article for @HarvardBiz on why leaders should adopt an emergent rather than a reductionist approach to #digitaltransformation https://t.co/sZwJmfDzje
@evgenymorozov This must make it difficult when discussing the exploração vs exploração algorithmic trade off!
@BrianRoemmele It’s still a very relevant metaphor for a lot of our supposedly automated systems. What we imagine to be human-free is often still AI theater!

Do we live in a world of sameness or difference? We typically focus on how big brands replicate and infiltrate local cultures. But brands are porous too, absorbing global divergences in behavior and taste. What if there is no center and edge just a network of sensors and signals? https://t.co/JpUwBRM1Eb

If you want to survive the future, constantly redefine your purpose. The Tesla Bot might seem shocking, but for Elon Musk, robotics is nothing new. In his words, "Tesla is arguably the world's biggest robotics company, our cars are basically semi-sentient robots on wheels." https://t.co/whF7qh1qwm

This may end up being the #AI equivalent of ‘The Mother Of All Demos’. The @OpenAI Codex story is not about an AI that can code, but the wild future of being able to ask a computer to do anything, and having it act virtually on your behalf #machinelearning https://t.co/9ZsVpU4Ijp
It starts with hunting rogue drones, but before long you get blade runners taking down illicit replicants #future
Back on a real stage! Getting ready to give the closing keynote for @Acumatica in Las Vegas with their visionary CEO @Jon_Roskill #AcumaticaSummit https://t.co/jdL0qplTJc

What if the end of the pandemic is not a pendulum swinging back to normality; but rather a portal from the world we knew to a radical new future that we are yet to fully understand? https://t.co/ThqX4hQMe9 #futureofwork #remotework #digitaldisruption #digitaltransformation

Should we stay, or should we go? Calling teams back to the office is already controversial - but what if the real issue is not remote vs. traditional work but rather - how do we reinvent the workplace? https://t.co/ank2xtbEC2

@philiprosedale @Dusanwriter The most interesting part of SL for me was how virtual interactions bled into the real world, signaled by pings on my cyberpunk BlackBerry. Would have been fascinating had your proto-NFT c/m/t infrastructure continued to evolve to envelope the AR mirror world that is coming next
Excited to be presenting at #CRMC2021 this September for @CRMCRetail on what it means to reimagine our organizations and leadership for this new era of AI-powered retail! https://t.co/ujQheIknsM

Interesting to see @Apple at #WWDC21 talking about shifting Siri’s processing from the cloud onto the Neural Engine processors on our devices. Better privacy, faster performance and as I wrote some time ago, a better model for personal AI  https://t.co/ccBQ5jLRnU

@BruceMctague @AtomicAdMan @commandodev @rhughesjones @drjasonfox @rnason_dal Thanks Bruce, I wrote Futuretainment in 2007. Fresh from experiencing the SARS crisis in HK, I was reflecting about the implications of the first iPhone that came out that year, and what pandemics and complexity science might reveal about the viral distribution of ideas.
Forget Millennials. We should worry about their kids. https://t.co/sujlJRu9Bm
@JayRCallahan Thanks Jay!

@janchip I looked at a related question many years ago in my book, Futuretainment. The South Koreans have a concept of 'chon' which delineates closeness in their social relations, and this was integrated into the design of early social networks like Cyworld. https://t.co/VPGmrbBwIH

What if within the span of the next decade, we could live for an additional ten years or more? Find out how AI will reshape the future of health in my conversation with @JOBhakdi CEO of Quantgene https://t.co/lp70wx2VWK

Honored to be featured on Chris Lee's (@speakersearch) podcast this week, talking about the future of AI-powered organizations, next generation leadership and why after a year of tough lessons, we are about to enter a new era of accelerating innovation https://t.co/MSdtMfd68s
